intro: Rebutia steinbachii subsp. tiraquensis, commonly known as the Tiraquén Cactus, is a small, globular cactus native to the arid regions of northern Argentina. It features a ribbed stem with spines that are typically brown or reddish in color. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to dry conditions, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. This subspecies is prized by cactus enthusiasts for its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
